question: Looking at the unemployment rate map, which statement below is the most accurate?

options.A: Illinois and Michigan have similar unemployment rates.
options.B: The unemployment gap between Illinois and Michigan might exceed that between Georgia and North Carolina.
options.C: All four states (Michigan, Illinois, Georgia and North Carolina) have very diverse unemployment levels.
options.D: The unemployment differences are impossible to determine from this visualization.

explanation: Illinois (9.2%) and Michigan (12.8%) have a 3.6 percentage point difference, while Georgia (3.9%) and North Carolina (2.7%) have only a 1.2 percentage point difference. However, the categorical color encoding groups Illinois and Michigan into the same color bin (9%+ range), making their large difference appear similar, while Georgia and North Carolina appear more different due to different color bins.
